sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"电报"之意。
means: cable ： 通常指通过海底电缆打的电报，也可指广义的电报。
telegram ： 常用词，指通过电报系统发出的信息，尤指具体的一份份电报。
telegraph ： 侧重指通信方式和电报业各，不可数名词，表想象概念。

sentence.Network_en: The Telegraph puts the union in a historical perspective.
sentence.Network_cn: 《电讯报》从历史的角度对该工会进行了报道。

sentence.Network_en: I ghosted his weekly rugby column for the Telegraph.
sentence.Network_cn: 我为他代写《电讯报》每周的橄榄球专栏。

sentence.Network_en: Mather was film critic on the Daily Telegraph for many years.
sentence.Network_cn: 马瑟多年来一直担任《每日电讯报》的影评人。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from French télégraphe, from télé- 'at a distance' + -graphe (see -graph)

entry.def: Telegraph is a system of sending messages over long distances, either by means of electricity or by radio signals. Telegraph was used more often before the invention of telephones.

entry.tran: 给…发电报;用电报发送(信息)
entry.def: To telegraph someone means to send them a message by telegraph.

example.ex: Churchill telegraphed an urgent message to Wavell...
example.tran: 丘吉尔给韦维尔发了封紧急电报。
“拜托，”他在电报中说，“别管它了。”

entry.def: If someone telegraphs something that they are planning or intending to do, they make it obvious, either deliberately or accidentally, that they are going to do it.

example.ex: The commission telegraphed its decision earlier this month by telling an official to prepare the order.
example.tran: 本月早些时候，委员会命令一位官员准备起草指令，透露了其决定。

means.word_mean: 1. apparatus used to communicate at a distance over a wire (usually in Morse code)

auth_sentence.content: Thus you can use the experiments like a telegraph.
auth_sentence.res_content: Thus you can use the experiments like a telegraph.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Thus you can use the experiments like a telegraph.

auth_sentence.content: That's what the telegraph was to the Victorians.
auth_sentence.res_content: That's what the telegraph was to the Victorians.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That's what the telegraph was to the Victorians.

auth_sentence.content: Minutes later the police telegraph machine sprang into action.
auth_sentence.res_content: Minutes later the police telegraph machine sprang into action.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Minutes later the police telegraph machine sprang into action.

stems_affixes.type_exp: =far,表示"远[引申为电,电从远方来]"

stems_affixes.word_buile: tele远[引申为电,电从远方来]+gram写,画→n.电报
tele远[引申为电,电从远方来]+graph写→用电写→电报
tele远[引申为电,电从远方来]+meter测量→远测量→遥测仪
tele远[引申为电,电从远方来]+phone声音,话机→n.电话,电话机 v.打电话
tele远[引申为电,电从远方来]+scope看→看远方→望远镜
tele远[引申为电,电从远方来]+vis看+ion表名词→看远方,通过电视看→电视
tele远[引申为电,电从远方来]+graph写→用电写→电报
tele远[引申为电,电从远方来]+phone声音,话机→n.电话,电话机 v.打电话
tele远[引申为电,电从远方来]+scope看→看远方→望远镜
tele远[引申为电,电从远方来]+vis看+e→看远方,通过电视等看
graph写,图+ic……的→adj.绘画似的, 图解的
graph写,图+ite表名词→用来写的东西→石墨
mono一个+graph写→写一个主题→专题论文
topo地方,场所+graph图+y→用图表等的方式描述地方→地形

stems_affixes.value_cn: 亲笔签名,题名或署名于……

Sentence.sentence: When telegraphs and trains brought in the idea that convenience was more important than content, Henry David Thoreau reminded us that'.

sentences.en: I will tell the result by telegraph.
Send the message on the telegraph.
sentences.cn: 这个消息用电报机发出。

means.word_mean: 打电报给；打电报传达(消息)

sentences.en: I telegraphed to him to come.

means.word_mean: 用电报发送;打电报向(某人)发指令

sentences.en: He telegraphed that he had arrived in London safe and sound.
sentences.cn: 他电告他已平安抵达伦敦。

sentences.en: They telegraphed us to leave immediately.
sentences.cn: 他们拍电报叫我们立即离开。

sentences.en: He telegraphed money to his son.
There’s a look about him that telegraphed bad news.
sentences.cn: 他那副样子流露出坏消息。
